qas.question: What famous ship left Southampton's port carrying the Pilgrim Fathers?
What year did the Mayflower set sail from Southampton?
How many crew members out of every five on the RMS Titanic were Sotonians?
What company operated passenger ships across the Atlantic, including the RMS Queen Elizabeth?
In what year did Southampton Container Terminals open?

context: The port was the point of departure for the Pilgrim Fathers aboard <a0_0>Mayflower<a0_0/> in <a1_0>1620<a1_0/>. In 1912, the RMS Titanic sailed from Southampton. <a2_0>Four<a2_0/> in five of the crew on board the vessel were Sotonians, with about a third of those who perished in the tragedy hailing from the city. Southampton was subsequently the home port for the transatlantic passenger services operated by <a3_0>Cunard<a3_0/> with their Blue Riband liner RMS Queen Mary and her running mate RMS Queen Elizabeth. In 1938, Southampton docks also became home to the flying boats of Imperial Airways. Southampton Container Terminals first opened in <a4_0>1968<a4_0/> and has continued to expand.
